conclusion: Consider initial direction and speed of A, arrangement of blocks, potential deflection and collision effects.
A is moving towards the right side of the image.
Assume A has enough momentum to collide with the blocks.
Several groups of blocks: blue, orange, red, green, and a single yellow block.
Blocks are arranged so A will first encounter the red blocks, followed by green, blue, and orange blocks.
A collides with the red blocks, causing deflection due to angle and number of blocks.
Deflection depends on mass and elasticity of A and blocks.
Assuming A is a small toy car, it might not have enough mass to significantly move the blocks.
A will be deflected by the red blocks.
After hitting red blocks, A will likely be deflected upwards or to the left.
A might then collide with the green blocks positioned to the left of the red blocks.
Green blocks will further deflect A, potentially towards blue or orange blocks.
A will probably come to a stop near the blue or orange blocks.
A will collide with red blocks first, then likely green blocks, and might stop near blue or orange blocks.
